Question: Which one of the following statements about colour spaces is incorrect?
Option A: A. The R, G, and B channels of the RGB colour space are often correlated.
Option B: B. The H and the S channel of the HSV colour space are confounded.
Option C: C. The Y channel of the YCbCr colour space represents the brightness.
Option D: D. The a* channel of the L*a*b* colour space is the green-blue component.

Question: Which one of the following statements about intensity transformations is incorrect?
Option A: A. Contrast stretching linearly maps intensities between two values to the full output range.
Option B: B. Log transformation maps a narrow range of high intensities to a wider range of output values.
Option C: C. Power transformation can map intensities similar to log and inverse log transformations.
Option D: D. Piecewise linear transformations can achieve contrast stretching and intensity slicing.

Option A: A. It approximates the sum of first-order derivatives in ğ‘¥ğ‘¥ and ğ‘¦ğ‘¦.
Option B: B. It approximates the sum of second-order derivatives in ğ‘¥ğ‘¥ and ğ‘¦ğ‘¦.
Option C: C. It approximates the product of first-order derivatives in ğ‘¥ğ‘¥ and ğ‘¦ğ‘¦.
Option D: D. It approximates the product of second-order derivatives in ğ‘¥ğ‘¥ and ğ‘¦ğ‘¦.

Question: Which one of the following statements on image filtering is incorrect?
Option A: A. Median filtering reduces noise in images.
Option B: B. Low-pass filtering results in blurry images.
Option C: C. High-pass filtering smooths fine details in images.
Option D: D. Notch filtering removes specific image frequencies.

Question: Which one of the following statements about feature descriptors is incorrect?
Option A: A. Haralick features are derived from gray-level co-occurrence matrices.
Option B: B. SIFT achieves rotation invariance by computing gradient histograms at multiple scales.
Option C: C. LBP describes local image texture and can be multiresolution and rotation-invariant.
Option D: D. Colour moments have lower representation capability than the colour histogram.

Question: Given the image below showing the result of a segmentation of various objects and the desired classification of these objects. The two different colours (red and green) indicate the two different classes which the objects are to be assigned to. A straightforward way to perform classification is by computing the value of a quantitative shape measure for each object and then thresholding those values. Suppose we compute the circularity and the eccentricity. Which of these two measures can be used to produce the shown classification?
Option A: A. Only circularity
Option B: B. Only eccentricity
Option C: C. Both circularity and eccentricity
Option D: D. Neither circularity nor eccentricity

Question: Which one of the following statements is correct for random forest classifiers?
Option A: A. Increasing the correlation between the individual trees decreases the random forest classification error rate.
Option B: B. Reducing the number of selected features at each node increases the correlation between the individual trees.
Option C: C. Reducing the number of selected features at each node increases the strength of the individual trees.
Option D: D. Increasing the strength of the individual trees decreases the random forest classification error rate.

Question: Which one of the following statements is correct for pattern recognition?
Option A: A. Pattern recognition is defined as the process of model training on a training dataset and then testing on an independent test set.
Option B: B. The dimension of feature vectors should be smaller than the number of training samples in order to avoid the overfitting problem.
Option C: C. The simple kNN classifier needs homogeneous feature types and scales so that the classification performance can be better.
Option D: D. SVM is a powerful classifier that can separate classes even when the feature space exhibits significant overlaps between classes.

Option A: A. The same objects as the input image whatever the input.
Option B: B. The same objects as the input image but with holes filled.

Question: Which one of the following lines describes the purpose of convolutional layers in CNNs?
Option A: A. Reducing the size of the feature maps.
Option B: B. Calculating the dot product of the input and kernels.
Option C: C. Applying a nonlinear activation function.
Option D: D. Making the network learn faster.

Question: Which one of the following lines describes the purpose of transfer learning?
Option A: A. Training a model from scratch for each new task.
Option B: B. Using a pretrained model and fine-tuning it for a new task.
Option C: C. Converting image data to text data to facilitate learning.
Option D: D. Combining multiple models into a single model for better performance.

Question: Which one of the following lines best describes the key benefit of CNNs over traditional ANNs for image classification?
Option A: A. CNNs are computationally less expensive.
Option B: B. CNNs automatically learn hierarchical features.
Option C: C. CNNs require fewer network layers.
Option D: D. CNNs can learn nonlinear mappings.

Question: Which one of the following networks is most suited for image segmentation tasks?
Option A: A. Multilayer perceptron (MLP)
Option B: B. Fully convolutional network (FCN)
Option C: C. Region proposal network (RPN)
Option D: D. Recurrent neural network (RNN)

Question: Which one of the following statements about motion analysis is incorrect?
Option A: A. Detection of moving objects by subtraction of successive images in a video works best if the background is constant.
Option B: B. Sparse motion estimation in a video can be done by template matching and minimising the mutual information measure.
Option C: C. Dense motion estimation using optical flow assumes that each small neighbourhood remains constant over time.
Option D: D. Optical flow provides an equation for each pixel but requires further constraints to solve the equation uniquely.

Question: Which one of the following statements about object tracking is incorrect?
Option A: A. The particle filtering method assumes that the dynamics model and the measurement model can be parameterized.
Option B: B. The hidden Markov model assumes that the measurements depend only on the current state of the objects.
Option C: C. The prediction step of Bayesian inference assumes that the current state of the objects depends only on the previous state.
Option D: D. The Kalman filtering method assumes that the dynamics and measurement noise are additive Gaussian.

Question: In many image processing operations, the image must be expanded a little bit to solve the boundary problem. Which one of the following types of expansion is implicitly used by the Fourier transform?
Option A: A. Padding
Option B: B. Clamping
Option C: C. Wrapping
Option D: D. Mirroring

Question: Which one of the following automatic thresholding methods will give the best segmentation result here?
Option A: A. Mean thresholding
Option B: B. IsoData thresholding
Option C: C. Otsu thresholding
Option D: D. Triangle thresholding

Question: Which one of the following statements about data augmentation for image classification using CNNs is correct?
Option A: A. Augmentation increases the number of parameters in the model.
Option B: B. Augmentation reduces the size of the dataset to speed up training.
Option C: C. Augmentation generates new training data by transforming the existing data.
Option D: D. Augmentation reduces the depth of the network for better performance.

Question: Which one of the following statements about image segmentation methods is incorrect?
Option A: A. Thresholding based on pixel intensity yields poor results if the regions to be segmented have overlapping intensity distributions.
Option B: B. Level-set segmentation uses an object boundary representation that makes it hard to deal with topological changes.
Option C: C. Region splitting techniques aim to optimize some metric of intra-region similarity and inter-region dissimilarity.
Option D: D. Watershed segmentation often results in over-segmentation because image regions may contain multiple local minima.
